title: Fundamental Accessibility Tests: Basic Functionality
description: These tests include starting the reading system and opening the titles, navigating the content, searching, and using bookmarks and notes.

tests.xhtml:
file-010 Operating system/Platform accessibility:

If you are using a hardware device, it can be started independently and essential accessibility for starting and exiting applications is available.

Indicate Pass or Fail.
tests.name: Operating system/Platform accessibility:
tests.description: If you are using a hardware device, it can be started independently and essential accessibility for starting and exiting applications is available.

tests.xhtml:
file-110 The reading system can be activated independently

If you are using a reading app that requires you to create an online account then the complete getting started process should be accessible.

Indicate Pass or Fail.
tests.name: The reading system can be activated independently
tests.description: If you are using a reading app that requires you to create an online account then the complete getting started process should be accessible.

tests.xhtml:
file-210 Open content

Open the Fundamental Accessibility Test book in the reading system.

If the test book is not available in the bookshelf, then open any other book that is available.

If the reading system also supports side loading, then please provide notes about the accessibility of the side loading feature.

Indicate Pass or Fail.
tests.name: Open content
tests.description: Open the Fundamental Accessibility Test book in the reading system.

tests.xhtml:
file-310 Access list of available content in the reading system

Check if you can navigate inside the bookshelf.

  1. Open the bookshelf or library in the Reading System
  2. Navigate the entries in the bookshelf or library view

Indicate Pass or Fail.
tests.name: Access list of available content in the reading system
tests.description: Check if you can navigate inside the bookshelf.

tests.xhtml:
nav-005 The table of contents in the app presents the content hierarchy

Check if the table of Contents is accessible and its hierarchy is presented correctly by the reading system

  1. Access the table of contents (TOC)in the reading system. Note that in most reading systems the TOC can be accessed using the menu or icons in the toolbars.
  2. Check the top ten entries in the table of contents
  3. Check if the following structure of table of content is presented. It may be presented in tree view, nested list view or any other view, the main objective is to verify if all section names are accessible and the order and level of the sections is correct and accessible.
  • Cover page - First entry in the TOC, this is at level 1
  • Front page - Second entry in the TOC, this is at level 1
  • Introduction - Third entry in the TOC, this is at level 1
  • Basic Functionality Tests - Fourth entry in the TOC, this is also at level 1
    • Operating system accessibility - Fifth entry in the TOC, this is at level 2
    • Reading system activation - Sixth entry in the TOC, this is at level 2
    • Open content - Seventh entry in the TOC, this is at level 2
    • Listing documents - Eighth entry in the TOC, this is also at level 2
  • Navigation Tests - Ninth entry in the TOC, this is at level 1

Indicate Pass or Fail.
tests.name: The table of contents in the app presents the content hierarchy
tests.description: Check if the table of Contents is accessible and its hierarchy is presented correctly by the reading system

tests.xhtml:
nav-010 Navigate to chapters through the Table of Contents

Check if you can navigate to a section by using the table of contents.

  1. Access the Table of content (TOC) of this book in the Reading System
  2. Select the section "Navigation Test" inside the Chapter "Supplemental Content" in the TOC
  3. Check if the focus has now moved to the desired section of the book ("Navigation Test").
  4. Use the link available there to return to this point.

Indicate Pass or Fail.
tests.name: Navigate to chapters through the Table of Contents
tests.description: Check if you can navigate to a section by using the table of contents.

tests.xhtml:
nav-110 Navigate content by pages

Check if you can navigate the content by pages.

Use the "Next/Previous Page" or "Go to Page" or the "Page List" feature in the Reading system and check if you are able to navigate to different pages. Check that you are able to determine which page you are currently in.

This EPUB file contains 10 hard coded page breaks. Note that these page breaks are different from the reflowed page numbers.

The supplementary guidance for conducting evaluations may be especially useful for completing this test. This can be downloaded from www.epubtest.org/instructions

Indicate Pass or Fail.
tests.name: Navigate content by pages
tests.description: Check if you can navigate the content by pages.

tests.xhtml:
nav-210 Navigate forward and backward through reflowed content

Use any control or command to navigate forward and backwards in the book content.

Note that some reading systems may be displaying text in a scrolling view and navigation by screen or page may not be available.

If you can move forwards and backwards in the book content by any means Using the selected Assistive Technology and Input method then this test passes.

Indicate Pass or Fail.
tests.name: Navigate forward and backward through reflowed content
tests.description: Use any control or command to navigate forward and backwards in the book content.

tests.xhtml:
nav-310 Read navigation information

Use the "Where am I?" or any other similar command available in the reading system and check if you can get information about your current position in the book.

The minimum information expected is current section and current page number. Percentage read, book title, author etc. can be additional useful information. It should be possible to resume reading from the last read position after using this command.

The supplementary guidance for conducting evaluations may be especially useful for completing this test. This can be downloaded from www.epubtest.org/instructions

Indicate Pass or Fail.
tests.name: Read navigation information
tests.description: Use the "Where am I?" or any other similar command available in the reading system and check if you can get information about your current position in the book.

tests.xhtml:
nav-410 Perform a search, review the search results

Perform a search, review the search results and navigate to the selected search result in the content.

  1. Search for the term "Taj Mahal" without the quotation marks in this book.
  2. Review the search results. This phrase appears only twice in this book.
  3. Navigate to the second search results. Use the link available there to return to this test.

Indicate Pass or Fail.
tests.name: Perform a search, review the search results
tests.description: Perform a search, review the search results and navigate to the selected search result in the content.

tests.xhtml:
nav-510 Move across chapters without using TOC

Check if you can move across chapters without having to use the Table of Contents.

  1. Move to the last section in this chapter which is "Review and navigate Notes".
  2. Continue reading and check if you are able to read the last lines of the current chapter and then the beginning lines of the next chapter which are reproduced below for convenience.

The last line of the current chapter is:

This line indicates the end of current chapter

If your reading system takes you to the next chapter, you will be able to read the following lines on the next HTML page:

Supplemental Content

Indicate Pass or Fail.
tests.name: Move across chapters without using TOC
tests.description: Check if you can move across chapters without having to use the Table of Contents.

tests.xhtml:
anno-010 Add a Bookmark or Highlight

Some reading systems may have a Highlight feature in place of Bookmarks. The tests for Bookmarks may then be performed with Highlights.

  1. Navigate to the beginning of this section i.e. Highlights, Notes and Bookmarks.
  2. Place a Bookmark or Highlight the section title.

Indicate Pass or Fail.
tests.name: Add a Bookmark or Highlight
tests.description: Some reading systems may have a Highlight feature in place of Bookmarks. The tests for Bookmarks may then be performed with Highlights.

tests.xhtml:
anno-110 Review and navigate Bookmarks or Highlights

Check if you can review and navigate Bookmarks or Highlights.

  1. Access and navigate list of Bookmarks or Highlights.
  2. Close the list(s) and resume reading.
  3. Access the list of Bookmarks or Highlights again and select an entry and check if you can move to the position where the Bookmark/Highlight was placed.

Indicate Pass or Fail.
tests.name: Review and navigate Bookmarks or Highlights
tests.description: Check if you can review and navigate Bookmarks or Highlights.

tests.xhtml:
anno-210 Add a note

Add a Note at this location in the book. Provide a few lines of text in the Note.

Indicate Pass or Fail.
tests.name: Add a note
tests.description: Add a Note at this location in the book. Provide a few lines of text in the Note.

tests.xhtml:
anno-310 Review and navigate Notes

Check if you can review and navigate Notes.

  1. Access and navigate list of Notes.
  2. Close the list(s) and resume reading.
  3. Access the list of Notes again and select a Note and check if you can move to the position where the Note was placed.

Indicate Pass or Fail.

This line indicates the end of current chapter
tests.name: Review and navigate Notes
tests.description: Check if you can review and navigate Notes.
